Description:
Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a VsCode "code.exe" process. This could indicate an attempt of persistence via VsCode tasks or terminal profiles.

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of VsCode
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (parent_process_path like '%\code.exe' and (((process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe' or process_path like '%\cmd.exe') and (command like '%invoke-expressions%' or command like '%iex%' or command like '%invoke-command%' or command like '%icm%' or command like '%downloadstring%' or command like '%rundll32%' or command like '%regsvr32%' or command like '%wscript%' or command like '%cscript%')) or (process_path like '%:\users\public\%' or process_path like '%:\windows\temp\%' or process_path like '%:\temp\%') or (process_path like '%\calc.exe' or process_path like '%\regsvr32.exe' or process_path like '%\rundll32.exe' or process_path like '%\cscript.exe' or process_path like '%\wscript.exe')))
